title: A Great Deal Of Cricket Enthusiasts Will Flock To Australia In 2020. Here’s Why!
text:
PARTNER

India’s true-blue cricket fanbase needs no introduction! The sport transcends every social and cultural barrier and unifies people like no other. The cricket fever peaks at an all-time-high during IPL and World Cup, and the josh knows no bounds. For those of you who aren’t keeping track, the much-awaited World Cup season is just around the corner.

Tourism Australia

This time around, not one but two World Cups are coming up - for men as well as women. Australia, whose passion for cricket is equally unmissable, is the host nation for the ICC T20 World Cup. What’s more? Australia is determined to make every cricket lovers dream come true, as the finals of both these tournaments will be held at the largest cricket stadium in the world, the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

Tourism Australia

True fans will agree, nothing comes close to the adrenaline rush and roaring enthusiasm that one experiences while watching a match at the stadium. Now imagine watching a World Cup Final at the world’s largest cricket stadium, hopefully cheering for our men and women in blue. I’m having goosebumps already!

The action will kick start right at the beginning of the New Year, with women leading the way. The Women’s edition of the ICC T20 World Cup will commence on 21st February with India taking on Australia in the opening match. One would not want to miss out on being a part of this iconic tournament, which is also attempting to set a new world record of highest attendance for a women’s sporting fixture at its finals, which is scheduled to coincide with International Women’s Day on 8 March.

Tourism Australia

Believe me, there’s no better opportunity than this to show our love and passion towards our women cricketers.

The latter half of the year will witness the men battle it out at the ICC T20 World Cup scheduled from 18th October to 15th November 2020. As the tournament coincides with the Diwali holidays, Australia is set to welcome Indian cricket enthusiasts in large numbers.

I mean, let’s ditch the usual sight-seeing stay-home vacays, and make our 2020 vacation as big and exciting as it gets. In addition to witnessing the world’s best cricketers play world-class cricket on one hand and can also indulge in a range of distinct experiences in Australia. From nightlife, wildlife to sceneries, name a thing and Australia’s got it!

Tourism Australia

What’s more? The Australian Department of Home Affairs is also offering Indian travellers a facility to lodge their visa applications online, thereby eliminating the need for personal interviews, biometrics, and physical submissions of passport and financial documents. If this is not a blessing then I don’t know what is!

With so much action to look forward to both in and around the stadiums, and plenty of exciting packages on offer, it is no surprise that all roads in 2020 will indeed lead to Australia. For now, I’m super pumped up about ICC Women’s World Cup 2020.

What are you waiting for? Buzz your friends and family, plan the vacation and make your bookings well in time!
